entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main protagonist of the story. He is mentioned as walking back to Gryffindor Tower with Ron, and he raises the subject of Unforgivable Curses.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is Harry's friend and companion. He is mentioned as walking back to Gryffindor Tower with Harry, and he responds to Harry's question about Moody and Dumbledore.

entities.name: moody
entities.description: Moody is a character who has been getting in trouble for years. He is mentioned as someone who attacks first and asks questions later.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster of Hogwarts. He is mentioned as someone who does things his way, and he would be in trouble with the Ministry if they knew about the Unforgivable Curses.

entities.name: ministry
entities.description: The Ministry is a governing body that has rules and regulations. They are mentioned as being concerned about Dumbledore's actions.

entities.name: fat lady
entities.description: The Fat Lady is a portrait who guards the entrance to Gryffindor Tower. She is mentioned as swinging forward to reveal the entrance hole.

entities.name: gryffindor tower
entities.description: Gryffindor Tower is a location in Hogwarts where students live and study. It is mentioned as being crowded and noisy.

entities.name: divination stuff
entities.description: Divination stuff refers to books and charts used for divination. Harry suggests getting this stuff, but Ron is reluctant.

entities.name: neville
entities.description: Neville is a student who is sitting alone in the dormitory reading. He is mentioned as being there when Harry and Ron go to fetch their books and charts.

relationships.description: Harry and Ron are friends who walk back to Gryffindor Tower together, discussing the Unforgivable Curses.
Harry is concerned about Moody's behavior and mentions that he attacks first and asks questions later.
Harry admires Dumbledore and mentions that he does things his way, even if it means getting in trouble with the Ministry.
Ron is friends with Harry and responds to his question about Moody and Dumbledore.
